CFM.synopsis: The druid Halsin appears at the player's camp and offers to help them find a cure for their tadpoles - a journey that will take them to a dangerous new region.(This dialog will play as a fallback Halsin is intended to join the player's camp in the event of a Grove lockdown or  if the player murders the grove/attack on den is auto-completed.)

CFM_163.speaker: Halsin
CFM_163.text: A fine camp you have here. Certainly an improvement on that filthy cage the goblins had me in.

CFM_222.speaker: Halsin
CFM_222.text: A fine camp you have here. My apologies for showing up unannounced.

CFM_97.speaker: Halsin
CFM_97.text: My thanks again, for all you did. With the grove safe, I am free to turn to other matters.

CFM_173.speaker: Halsin
CFM_173.text: I owe you a debt for seeing to the goblins' leaders. Now I'm here to pay that debt.

CFM_86.speaker: Halsin
CFM_86.text: I heard how you saved the grove; it wouldn't be right for me to let you leave without expressing my gratitude.

CFM_81.speaker: Halsin
CFM_81.text: I wish to come with you, help solve this problem that's plaguing you. It's the least I can do.

CFM_37.speaker: Halsin
CFM_37.text: The path is now clear - we have to get to Moonrise Towers. Do you remember what I told you? About getting there?

CFM_209.speaker: Player
CFM_209.text: I remember. To Moonrise Towers, then.

CFM_40.speaker: Halsin
CFM_40.text: Indeed, and may the Oak Father watch over us on our journey. We will speak soon, I'm sure.

CFM_125.speaker: Halsin
CFM_125.text: There is a terrible curse surrounding Moonrise Towers - a shadow curse that drains away all light and life.

CFM_93.speaker: Halsin
CFM_93.text: Few can resist it without dying or transforming into shadow beings. You can try to journey overland if you wish, but I strongly advise you go under.

CFM_20.speaker: Halsin
CFM_20.text: There is a tunnel leading from the temple of Selûne right down into the Underdark and beyond. The entrance is hidden somewhere in the ruins.

CFM_94.speaker: Halsin
CFM_94.text: I believe if you find this entrance, you'll discover a route that leads to Moonrise Towers, bypassing the worst of the shadow curse.

CFM_198.speaker: Halsin
CFM_198.text: Aradin and his lot were looking for the same entrance - they sought an artefact called the Nightsong that was supposed to be housed somewhere down there.

CFM_42.speaker: Player
CFM_42.text: Seems it's high time we got on our way.

CFM_22.speaker: Halsin
CFM_22.text: I will join you, help you with that which plagues you. The illithid curse is a blight to all nature.

CFM_166.speaker: Halsin
CFM_166.text: There is hope... but it isn't found here, at my hands - at least not yet.

CFM_30.speaker: Halsin
CFM_30.text: There's a chokehold of magic, binding the creature to you. Any efforts to remove it would almost certainly kill you - or worse.

CFM_223.speaker: Player
CFM_223.text: You promised you'd do something about my infection.

CFM_172.speaker: Halsin
CFM_172.text: Patience. I can't just snap my fingers... but I know where the solution almost certainly lies - Moonrise Towers.

CFM_46.speaker: Halsin
CFM_46.text: It's the source of this magic, and where the cultists send their captives - to be infected. They're building an army. Innocents go in, True Souls come out.

CFM_245.speaker: Halsin
CFM_245.text: Find whoever's behind the parasites and the magic. If we can understand it, then perhaps we can cure it - provided you survive long enough.

CFM_132.speaker: Halsin
CFM_132.text: Luckily, you have time - this magic has slowed your ceremorphosis to a crawl. I just can't fathom why someone would do that.

CFM_53.speaker: Wyll
CFM_53.text: At last, a cure is in reach. To the Towers, then, where the moonlight will lend way to a new dawn.

CFM_12.speaker: Lae'zel
CFM_12.text: These tadpoles obey one master. If the ghaik have united in a single Creed, my Queen is in danger.

CFM_107.speaker: Lae'zel
CFM_107.text: Once we are cleansed, we infiltrate Moonrise Towers. Should there be ghaik, we snatch their heads, one by one.

CFM_146.speaker: Gale
CFM_146.text: This is sobering news indeed, but there's no use crying over spilt milk. If this is our only option, to Moonrise Towers we go.

CFM_4.speaker: Karlach
CFM_4.text: We get a cure and the chance to hit these arseholes where they live? Sounds good to me.

CFM_67.speaker: Player
CFM_67.text: Moonrise Towers? What is that place?

CFM_119.speaker: Halsin
CFM_119.text: An ancient citadel, abandoned for years - and for very good reason - until these cultists took it over.

CFM_224.speaker: Halsin
CFM_224.text: Apart from facing legions of Absolute followers? The whole region is shrouded in a curse - a shadow curse.

CFM_242.speaker: Halsin
CFM_242.text: For years now, this curse has consumed all light and life. It spits out only darkness and despair.

CFM_35.speaker: Halsin
CFM_35.text: Few survive long - those who do are transformed by the curse. It is not a place to venture into lightly.

CFM_231.speaker: Player
CFM_231.text: There's no time to spare, then - to Moonrise Towers.

CFM_247.speaker: Halsin
CFM_247.text: Wait, please. There's more. The whole region around Moonrise is shrouded in a curse - a shadow curse.

CFM_142.speaker: Player
CFM_142.text: Doesn't sound like I've much choice - I need to get to Moonrise, curse or not.

CFM_138.speaker: Halsin
CFM_138.text: You're half right - you have to get to Moonrise, but you still have a choice of how to get there.

CFM_68.speaker: Player
CFM_68.text: The Absolute's forces can tolerate such a place?

CFM_64.speaker: Halsin
CFM_64.text: So it seems, though I don't know how. You will have to choose your approach carefully.

CFM_88.speaker: Halsin
CFM_88.text: You could go overland - along the Risen Road or through the mountains. Easier at first, but you'll run into the shadow curse eventually.

CFM_18.speaker: Halsin
CFM_18.text: You could also go under. There is a tunnel somewhere in the ruined temple of Selûne. It leads to Moonrise Towers through the Underdark.

CFM_110.speaker: Halsin
CFM_110.text: Long ago, a man called Ketheric Thorm built a secret stronghold deep down there, before rallying a whole army of Dark Justiciars - Shar worshippers.

CFM_15.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_15.text: Dark Justiciars? I must see for myself.

CFM_158.speaker: Halsin
CFM_158.text: Aradin and his lot were looking for a way down there - they were promised riches if they retrieved a relic called the Nightsong. But I think there's more.

CFM_179.speaker: Halsin
CFM_179.text: From this stronghold, Ketheric's forces could access both the temple of Selûne and Moonrise Towers - but he was defeated before he could launch an attack.

CFM_191.speaker: Halsin
CFM_191.text: If you can find this place, I'll wager it will reveal a path to Moonrise Towers, bypassing the worst of the shadow curse.

CFM_80.speaker: Player
CFM_80.text: I already found the place you're talking about - it's called Grymforge.
CFM_80.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player has already entered the grymforge but has not yet spoken to Halsin about it.

CFM_244.speaker: Halsin
CFM_244.text: You've already been? Impressive. You'll make me redundant at this rate. What did you find?
CFM_244.context: NodeContext: Impressed and a little amused at the player's diligence (finding a place before he can even tell them about it)

CFM_38.speaker: Player
CFM_38.text: I found an elevator - but it leads right into the shadow curse.
CFM_38.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player clicked the elevator from Grymforge to SCL

CFM_211.speaker: Halsin
CFM_211.text: That sounds like what you need. But the next part of the journey mightn't be straightforward - or safe.

CFM_178.speaker: Player
CFM_178.text: Absolute followers - but that's about all.
CFM_178.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player didn't click the elevator from Grymforge to SCL

CFM_60.speaker: Halsin
CFM_60.text: Keep looking. If they're present, then it's likely there's a route to Moonrise somewhere.

CFM_246.speaker: Player
CFM_246.text: Danger. Are you sure that's the best way to Moonrise?

CFM_79.speaker: Halsin
CFM_79.text: I'm certain. The Underdark is dangerous, yes, but the alternative is suicide. Be patient and be thorough - the path will reveal itself in time.

CFM_199.speaker: Player
CFM_199.text: I've got more exploring to do.

CFM_39.speaker: Halsin
CFM_39.text: Tread carefully. You're on the right track, I'm sure - but there'll still be danger and difficulty before you reach Moonrise.

CFM_217.speaker: Halsin
CFM_217.text: It may prove impossible to avoid the shadow curse entirely, but if you find any way to limit your exposure, seize it.
CFM_217.context: InternalNodeContext: GLO_Halsin_AcknowledgedGrymforge sets whenever the player enquires about the Grymforge and Halsin acknowledges how it may relate to the journey to Moonrise.

CFM_36.speaker: Player
CFM_36.text: I found the hidden entrance in the temple of Selûne - the way is clear.

CFM_185.speaker: Halsin
CFM_185.text: Already...? If only I'd gone with you instead of Aradin.

CFM_248.speaker: Player
CFM_248.text: I've already found a way into the Underdark. I can pick up the trail from there.

CFM_161.speaker: Player
CFM_161.text: So how do I find this underground route?

CFM_154.speaker: Halsin
CFM_154.text: You'll need to pick up where Aradin left off - find the hidden entrance. It's somewhere in the temple of Selûne.

CFM_202.speaker: Halsin
CFM_202.text: One of the adventurers had a clue to help find it - a dwarf called Brian. It might still be found on his corpse, wherever the goblins left it.

CFM_215.speaker: Player
CFM_215.text: I don't want to risk getting lost in the Underdark - I'll journey overland.

CFM_116.speaker: Halsin
CFM_116.text: You may reconsider once you see the effects of the curse for yourself.

CFM_55.speaker: Halsin
CFM_55.text: I would like to join your camp, if you'll allow me. I can offer my skills, my counsel.

CFM_137.speaker: Halsin
CFM_137.text: I've long sought to return to Moonrise Towers - unfinished business. It seems our fates have aligned.

CFM_210.speaker: Player
CFM_210.text: How do I find this passage through the Underdark?

CFM_1.speaker: Player
CFM_1.text: Say I decide to try this Underdark route after all - how do I get started?

CFM_62.speaker: Halsin
CFM_62.text: I advise you start in the temple of Selûne - if you find the Dark Justiciars' hidden entrance, it could lead you all the way to Moonrise.

CFM_238.speaker: Player
CFM_238.text: You want to go to Moonrise yourself? Why?

CFM_175.speaker: Halsin
CFM_175.text: Those illithid creatures threaten the natural order - it's my duty to do what I can to stop them.

CFM_7.speaker: Halsin
CFM_7.text: There's also the shadow curse - it's an affront and must be cleansed.

CFM_127.speaker: Halsin
CFM_127.text: I helped overthrow Ketheric Thorm and his Dark Justiciars years ago. But I failed to prevent him from unleashing darkness across the region before he was defeated.

CFM_151.speaker: Halsin
CFM_151.text: I spent years researching the curse, trying to put an end to it. Nothing has worked - yet.

CFM_237.speaker: Halsin
CFM_237.text: If I can join you and get close to Moonrise, perhaps I can lift this curse, same as you may find a cure for your infection.

CFM_181.speaker: Player
CFM_181.text: Is that why you went with Aradin? You thought he might find this route to Moonrise?

CFM_201.speaker: Halsin
CFM_201.text: Precisely. Then perhaps I could have done something about both the shadow curse and ceremorphosis aberrations.

CFM_43.speaker: Halsin
CFM_43.text: But in my eagerness, I put far too much faith in the abilities of Aradin and his band. We didn't even get close.

CFM_10.speaker: Halsin
CFM_10.text: One of those who died had a clue that was supposed to help us find the hidden entrance to the Underdark.

CFM_160.speaker: Halsin
CFM_160.text: A dwarf called Brian, I believe. Though there's no guarantee that the goblins left him recognisable.

CFM_32.speaker: Halsin
CFM_32.text: It's lost to me. Perhaps in time I can open it up to the world again, but for now, I must help you.

CFM_90.speaker: Halsin
CFM_90.text: I've chosen a successor as First Druid - Francesca of the High Forest. A bird's already been dispatched to summon her.

CFM_71.speaker: Player
CFM_71.text: First and only Druid. What will Francesca even do here?

CFM_41.speaker: Halsin
CFM_41.text: She can tend to the grove, help it heal. In time, others will join. Perhaps some day I can return.

CFM_112.speaker: Halsin
CFM_112.text: A fellow druid. I can count on her to tend to the grove in my absence. Help it heal.

CFM_187.speaker: Halsin
CFM_187.text: Precisely! Who indeed? You do not know, and neither do any of the others.
CFM_187.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

CFM_240.speaker: Player
CFM_240.text: There's nobody in the grove you'd choose?

CFM_206.speaker: Halsin
CFM_206.text: No. At least, not right now.

CFM_113.speaker: Player
CFM_113.text: What about one of the others? Rath, perhaps?

CFM_196.speaker: Halsin
CFM_196.text: Rath has promise, but he has a ways to go yet. He wasn't able to stop Kagha by himself. The grove needs experience and a strong hand.

CFM_63.speaker: Halsin
CFM_63.text: I need her to stay focused on her training - the grove will need a skilled healer in my absence.

CFM_19.speaker: Halsin
CFM_19.text: I'm glad you approve - I do not truly care if you approve, but I am glad.

CFM_140.speaker: Halsin
CFM_140.text: The grove needs to move beyond the mistakes of the past. What it needs is an unknown quantity; an outsider who can enforce the Oak Father's teachings without bias.

CFM_133.speaker: Halsin
CFM_133.text: This is why I chose Francesca. She will restore simplicity and purity to the grove in my absence.

CFM_189.speaker: Halsin
CFM_189.text: Contrary to how some think of us, we druids can play politics when necessary.

CFM_152.speaker: Halsin
CFM_152.text: Resentment will spring up like mushrooms no matter what I do. You cannot please everyone and you'd be a fool to try.

CFM_2.speaker: Halsin
CFM_2.text: Now, we've quite the journey ahead. Best get started.

CFM_130.speaker: Player
CFM_130.text: Sounds like the grove will be in good hands, then. We should get going.

CFM_82.speaker: Halsin
CFM_82.text: Indeed. We've quite the journey ahead of us.

CFM_51.speaker: Player
CFM_51.text: You mentioned you had unfinished business in Moonrise Towers - what did you mean?

CFM_92.speaker: Player
CFM_92.text: I never thought I'd say this, but it sounds like the Underdark is the safer route.

CFM_134.speaker: Halsin
CFM_134.text: Anything is preferable to risking the shadow curse.

CFM_58.speaker: Halsin
CFM_58.text: The decision is yours, but I'd favour the Underdark. Even a place like that is the lesser evil compared to the shadow-cursed lands.

CFM_50.speaker: Player
CFM_50.text: This shadow curse - does it affect Shar worshippers?

CFM_203.speaker: Halsin
CFM_203.text: I don't know. Ketheric's followers were defeated or vanished before the effects of the curse took hold.

CFM_3.speaker: Player
CFM_3.text: Are these Sharrans still to be found?

CFM_87.speaker: Halsin
CFM_87.text: As bones, perhaps. But their hidden structures might still remain.

CFM_159.speaker: Player
CFM_159.text: I know the Underdark - it's lethal. I'll travel overland.

CFM_103.speaker: Player
CFM_103.text: The Underdark's my home. Better to take that route than risk this curse.

CFM_180.speaker: Player
CFM_180.text: I'm sure there must be other ways to cure myself.

CFM_101.speaker: Halsin
CFM_101.text: By all means - pursue any leads you may have. But I sense all roads will lead to Moonrise, in the end.

CFM_144.speaker: Player
CFM_144.text: How are you so sure Moonrise is where I have to go?

CFM_77.speaker: Halsin
CFM_77.text: Nature speaks to me. Birds report what they've seen. And I've overheard goblins speaking of it, too. Moonrise is at the heart of all this, I'm sure of it.

CFM_34.speaker: Player
CFM_34.text: I was expecting more from you than a lead towards some distant, dangerous prospect.

CFM_192.speaker: Halsin
CFM_192.text: I won't be held accountable just because you're naive enough to expect easy answers. Now allow me to continue.

CFM_216.speaker: Player
CFM_216.text: That's it? Just go to this place?

CFM_49.speaker: Halsin
CFM_49.text: What, were you expecting a spell? A potion? Or perhaps you thought I'd conduct a cack-handed operation on you right here.

CFM_234.speaker: Halsin
CFM_234.text: What were you expecting? That I'd mumble a spell or whip out a potion?

CFM_200.speaker: Astarion
CFM_200.text: Finally, we're catching up on our puppet master. And the hunt ends at Moonrise Towers.

CFM_109.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_109.text: I suppose it was too much to hope we were going to be cured here and now. To Moonrise, then.

CFM_241.speaker: Player
CFM_241.text: That doesn't sound much like hope to me. Can't you just help here and now?

CFM_208.speaker: Player
CFM_208.text: This magic isn't typical of ceremorphosis?

CFM_213.speaker: Halsin
CFM_213.text: No, this is different. Altered. But I believe I know where answers can be found - Moonrise Towers.

CFM_78.speaker: Player
CFM_78.text: You learned all this from your studies?

CFM_186.speaker: Halsin
CFM_186.text: Indeed. After we dealt with the drow that ambushed us, Nettie and I were able to inspect the corpse - and the creature that slithered out of it.

CFM_91.speaker: Player
CFM_91.text: How do you know all this?

CFM_121.speaker: Halsin
CFM_121.text: A drow forced me to defend myself. Afterwards, I was able to study the parasite that slithered out of the corpse, see what drives these 'True Souls'.

CFM_122.speaker: Halsin
CFM_122.text: I had no idea anyone beyond their ranks was infected. You have my sincere sympathies.

CFM_76.speaker: Player
CFM_76.text: This magic you mentioned - it isn't normal for these parasites?

CFM_156.speaker: Halsin
CFM_156.text: I have nowhere else to turn, it seems. I went to the grove, but... I cannot face what has happened there.

CFM_117.speaker: Halsin
CFM_117.text: It is sealed off to me, to the whole world. Forever, perhaps.

CFM_105.speaker: Halsin
CFM_105.text: If you hadn't seen to the leaders of that goblin horde, the grove would be no more. I am in your debt.

CFM_9.speaker: Halsin
CFM_9.text: I am Halsin, First Druid of the Emerald Grove - and I owe you my thanks.

CFM_29.speaker: Halsin
CFM_29.text: If you hadn't killed the leaders of that goblin horde, the grove would be no more. I am in your debt.

CFM_75.speaker: Halsin
CFM_75.text: Don't worry, I'm not here just to sing your praises. I believe I can help - with your tadpole.

CFM_205.speaker: Halsin
CFM_205.text: I am Halsin, First Druid of the Emerald Grove - which you saved. Thank you.

CFM_165.speaker: Halsin
CFM_165.text: I am Halsin, First Druid of the Emerald Grove.

CFM_129.speaker: Halsin
CFM_129.text: Or I was, at least. I went there - the grove is sealed off to me, to the whole world.

CFM_227.speaker: Player
CFM_227.text: First Druid? You sound like someone who could help with a problem I have...

CFM_47.speaker: Halsin
CFM_47.text: I know. It's what brings me here.

CFM_120.speaker: Halsin
CFM_120.text: I sensed what was done to you from afar. Now let me confirm it; I need to know exactly what we're dealing with...

CFM_100.speaker: Halsin
CFM_100.text: Thank you. I will grieve when I can, but for now, I must find another way to serve nature - by helping you.

CFM_131.speaker: Player
CFM_131.text: Forget about the grove. What are you doing here?

CFM_228.speaker: Halsin
CFM_228.text: Looking for you, of course. We have work to do.

CFM_236.speaker: Halsin
CFM_236.text: I'm here for you. I believe I can help with the parasite lurking within.

CFM_45.speaker: Halsin
CFM_45.text: All too well - I could even sense it from afar. Now let me confirm it; I need to know exactly what we're dealing with...

CFM_235.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

CFM_197.speaker: Halsin
CFM_197.text: Oak Father preserve you, child... You're infected, aren't you? The mind flayers' spawn.

CFM_56.speaker: Halsin
CFM_56.text: But... something's different. You're aware of the monster inside you. You don't bow to the Absolute, like the True Souls do...

CFM_150.speaker: Player
CFM_150.text: I escaped from an illithid ship after being infected. Maybe the process was interrupted.

CFM_5.speaker: Halsin
CFM_5.text: Perhaps... but I wouldn't want to place all my faith in blind luck.

CFM_162.speaker: Halsin
CFM_162.text: I was right to seek you out. You're after a cure for this parasite.

CFM_24.speaker: Player
CFM_24.text: I'm shielded from the worst of the parasite's magic.

CFM_128.speaker: Halsin
CFM_128.text: That sounds... novel. What is it that protects you?

CFM_233.speaker: Player
CFM_233.text: You can see that I have free will - you don't need to know any more than that.

CFM_26.speaker: Halsin
CFM_26.text: I'd still be target practice for goblins if you hadn't come along. I think I can trust you.

CFM_74.speaker: Halsin
CFM_74.text: And I may be able to help you find a more definitive solution to your problem.

CFM_73.speaker: Halsin
CFM_73.text: But I'm afraid it won't be easy, or quick.

CFM_148.speaker: Halsin
CFM_148.text: There's a chokehold of magic, binding the creature to you. Any efforts to remove it would almost certainly kill you - or worse.

CFM_118.speaker: Player
CFM_118.text: 'Almost'? That means I still have a chance. One I intend to take.

CFM_171.speaker: Halsin
CFM_171.text: Your resolve is most admirable. It'll serve you well for where you've to go - Moonrise Towers.

CFM_221.speaker: Player
CFM_221.text: That doesn't sound much like hope to me. Can't you help?

CFM_167.speaker: Halsin
CFM_167.text: Patience. I can't just snap my fingers... but I know where the solution almost certainly lies - Moonrise Towers.

CFM_99.speaker: Player
CFM_99.text: This magic isn't typical of ceremorphosis?

CFM_27.speaker: Halsin
CFM_27.text: No, this is different. Altered. But I believe I know where answers can be found - Moonrise Towers.

CFM_229.speaker: Halsin
CFM_229.text: That place is where the cultists send their captives. Innocents go in, True Souls come out. It has to be the source of this magic.

CFM_170.speaker: Player
CFM_170.text: And you think I'll find a cure if I find this source at Moonrise?

CFM_147.speaker: Halsin
CFM_147.text: Precisely. If we can understand just what this magic is, then perhaps we can rid you of this parasite.

CFM_164.speaker: Halsin
CFM_164.text: It's immensely powerful, whatever it is - strong enough to slow ceremorphosis to a crawl. Luckily, that gives you more time.

CFM_123.speaker: Player
CFM_123.text: That must be where the ship was taking me - before it crashed.

CFM_95.speaker: Halsin
CFM_95.text: Be glad it did, or you'd be a True Soul by now.

CFM_114.speaker: Player
CFM_114.text: I wasn't taken to Moonrise - I was infected on a mind flayer ship, before it crashed.

CFM_13.speaker: Halsin
CFM_13.text: And where do you suppose that ship was taking you? Moonrise, I'll wager. The journey differs, but the problem is the same.

CFM_157.speaker: Halsin
CFM_157.text: If we can get to Moonrise and understand just what this magic is, then perhaps we can rid you of this parasite.

CFM_83.speaker: Player
CFM_83.text: You learned all this from your studies?

CFM_230.speaker: Halsin
CFM_230.text: Indeed. After we dealt with the drow that ambushed us, Nettie and I were able to inspect the corpse - and the creature that slithered out of it.

CFM_17.speaker: Player
CFM_17.text: How do you know all this?

CFM_54.speaker: Halsin
CFM_54.text: A drow forced me to defend myself. Afterwards, I was able to study the parasite that slithered out of the corpse, see what drives these 'True Souls'.

CFM_6.speaker: Halsin
CFM_6.text: I had no idea anyone beyond their ranks was infected. You have my sincere sympathies.

CFM_85.speaker: Player
CFM_85.text: This magic you mentioned - it isn't normal for these parasites?

CFM_57.speaker: Player
CFM_57.text: I'm not entirely sure - but I'll take all the help I can get.

CFM_214.speaker: Halsin
CFM_214.text: Hmm. Sometimes a mysterious cure is worse than the disease.

CFM_169.speaker: Halsin
CFM_169.text: I may be able to help you find a more definitive solution to your problem.

CFM_8.speaker: Player
CFM_8.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

CFM_106.speaker: Halsin
CFM_106.text: Don't be coy - I can sense the imbalance in you. Now let me confirm it, so I can be certain of what we're dealing with...
